questions.question_text: Which Palo Alto Networks component provides consolidated policy creation and centralized management?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/8-1/data-center-best-practices/data-center-best-practice-security-policy/use-palo-alto-networks-assessment-and-review-tools

"Prevention Posture Assessment (PPA)—The PPA is a set of questionnaires that help uncover security risk prevention gaps across all areas of network and security architecture. The PPA not only helps to identify all security risks, it also provides detailed suggestions on how to prevent the risks and close the gaps. The assessment, guided by an experienced Palo Alto Networks sales engineer, helps determine the areas of greatest risk where you should focus prevention activities. You can run the PPA on firewalls and on Panorama."

Selected Answer: B
The Keyword here is "Assessment"

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/10-2/data-center-best-practices/data-center-best-practice-security-policy/use-palo-alto-networks-assessment-and-review-tools

questions.question_text: Which statement is true regarding a Prevention Posture Assessment?

choices.B: It provides a set of questionnaires that help uncover security risk prevention gaps across all areas of network and security architecture
choices.C: It provides a percentage of adoption for each assessment area
choices.A: The Security Policy Adoption Heatmap component filters the information by device groups, serial numbers, zones, areas of architecture, and other categories
choices.D: It performs over 200 security checks on Panorama/firewall for the assessment

questions.question_text:
Which two configuration settings shown are not the default? (Choose two.)
//IMG//

discussion.content:
B & C true answers.
By default - Server Log Monitor Frequency (sec) - 2
By default - Enable Session - disabled

Selected Answer: BC
Server Log Monitor Frequency (sec): 15
The default value is 2 seconds, but in this setup, it is changed to 15 seconds.

Enable Session
This is not enabled by default. Since it is checked in the setup, it indicates a non-default configuration.
B & C Correct , Checked with Device
B&C Corretas - Padrão do Frequency é 2 e Enable Session "Disable"

Selected Answer: CD
For PAN-OS 10.0 Enable Session + Client Probing are disabled by default for Integrated User-ID Agent

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/8-1/pan-os-web-interface-help/user-identification/device-user-identification-user-mapping/user-id-agent-setup/user-id-agent-setup-server-monitoring.html#id3f6fc5de-993d-4538-9f06-17fe9d9a4130

I think correct answers are C and D
C --> Do not Enable Session. This setting requires that the User-ID agent have an Active Directory account with Server Operator privileges so that it can read all user sessions.
D --> Do not enable client probing on high-security networks. Do not enable client probing on external untrusted interfaces.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/8-1/pan-os-web-interface-help/user-identification/device-user-identification-user-mapping/user-id-agent-setup/user-id-agent-setup-server-monitoring.html
